Description: Tobacco pipe-bowl made of ivory, in two portions: (a) the bowl with cross-hatching, and (b) the other part with circles and dots.
Curator's comments: Slip records: 'Belonged to King Mtesa of Uganda by whom it was given to one of the officers of the Egyptian Expedition.'
Acquisition name: Donated by: Isma'il Pasha, Viceroy of Egypt
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: King of Uganda Mtesa
Acquisition notes: Af,+.989 to 1003.a were presented to the BM by the Khedive of Egypt (Isma'il Pasha) on 1 December 1878, and had all been previously shown in the Paris Exhibition of 1878. This had been no.54.
